formalText: Next week, he will miss Monday, but we can keep Thursday Friday.

He said last week was weird, he was sleeping the whole week and "didn't know what the fuck was going on but I was sleeping every day until like two one I don't know like I was exhausted it was really weird"
He could just feel like he was absolutely exhausted when he went to Starbucks
Explained a day where he got up and kind of ate something and got back and was just depressed
to the point to where he didn't mention it to my mom.
He said "With all that shit with the fire department and the it was already an exhausting week".
Started sobbing when he saw a yoga video about someone changing their life
He didn't understand why he was sobbing and it was really weird.
He said "This poor guy is like seriously overweight disabled, you know, it gives you perspective"
"The last time I felt very disturbed was the time I told you when I first got to London.
That felt really unsettling and I was only because I just felt really alone"
I felt like
there wasn't anybody I could call or hang out with. I just felt really weird and alone and just unsettled ever since then every time I had a job like that"
He is considering not saying yes to going back to school
He said "I am living my life and I don't feel so guilty about the PHD or whatever
I pulled up my manuscript for the new book and I was like shit man.
Some of these poems are really fucking good.
He said he had a wonderful weekend with a new girl named Kelly saying, "she's awesome
I was going to tell you this if this is the first relationship I've had where the sex has gotten better with the more open we've been with one another
She's freaking beautiful and awesome" He is worried about messing it up with her and finds motivation in their relationship
He said, "I just think it's important to start branching out
I feel very connected"
When asked "What you do with all these feelings you're starting to have as things happen and you see them for what they are now?"
He said "I mean, I don't think there's much more that I could do"
